intro: Astragalus zayuensis, commonly known as the Yarlung Tsangpo Astragalus, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its leguminous properties and typical pea-like flowers. The plant is adapted to cold and arid environments, thriving at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in late summer, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
